entries.meaning: A tool which projects a controlled stream of a highly flammable gas over a spark in order to produce a controlled flame.

examples: When the firecan jockeys have flown their blowtorches some 100,000 miles, the doctors take over for the ground physical.

verbs.description: blowtorch (third-person singular simple present blowtorches, present participle blowtorching, simple past and past participle blowtorched)

entries.meaning: To apply a blowtorch to something.
